content: Dipyridin-4-ylsulfane (dps, 4 mmol, 0.44 g) and CoCl2·6H2O (2 mmol, 0.476 g) was added to 30 mL of water, heated to 60 °C, and stirred for 3 h to obtain a pink solution, which was filtered and evaporated at room temperature to produce red crystals after a few days. Elemental analyses calcd (%) for C20H16Cl2CoN4S2: C: 47.44, H: 3.19, N: 11.07; found: C: 47.46, H: 3.22, N: 11.05.
clean_text:
Experimental Section

[Co(dps)2(C)2] n  (1)

Dipyridin-4-ylsulfane (dps, 4 mmol, 0.44 g) and CoCl2⋅6H2O (2 mmol, 0.476 g) was added to 30 mL of water, heated to 60 °C, and stirred for 3 h to obtain a pink solution, which was filtered and evaporated at room temperature to produce red crystals after a few days. Elemental analyses calcd (%) for C20H16Cl2CoN4S2: C: 47.44, H: 3.19, N: 11.07; found: C: 47.46, H: 3.22, N: 11.05.
